snippet: A veiled apology was offered after the Turkish prime minister, a crucial mediator, chastised Iran’s leaders for seeking to move talks from Turkey to Iraq or Syria.
abstract: Iran's leaders backpedal from their criticism of Turkey, the host of coming talks on disputed Iranian nuclear program, in possible indication of their concern about alienating the Turks at time when Iran is facing increased isolation.
lead_paragraph: A veiled apology was offered after the Turkish prime minister, a crucial mediator, chastised Iran’s leaders for seeking to move talks from Turkey to Iraq or Syria.

headline.seo: Iran Softens Criticism of Turkey as Nuclear Talks Approach
headline.main: As Nuclear Talks Near, Iran Softens Criticism of Turkey
headline.print_headline: As Nuclear Talks Near, Iran Softens Criticism of Turkey
